column4: why the hell is there no (good) open source alternative to partition magic?
sorry, I've had a bit of wine tonight
actually I heard when partition magic does it, it takes forever and is very unreliable
doesn't matter... at least it tries :P
obviously, only an idiot would count on that (i.e., not backup beforehand)
if you are going to back up your data, why is that feature even necessary in the first place?
I mean, why not just move all the data off of your partition, erase it, and repartition the way you want?  No need for partition magic to do somethnig that might screw up your data
but it would be nice to have something that can move your stuff, too
the $50 rebate was before or after the $100?
after.  So it ended up being $50 for a 7200rpm 120gb hard drive.
